{"id":1013439112,"question_id":2916,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"10 months, 1 week","timestamp":1691290988,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/1013439112/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Check if it is Possible to Split Array","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution {\n    public boolean canSplitArray(List<Integer> nums, int m) {\n        \n        int len = nums.size();\n        if(len<=2)\n            return true;\n        \n        List<Integer> list = new ArrayList<>();\n        \n        \n        boolean head = false;\n        boolean tail = false;\n        \n        int sum=0;\n        for(int i=0;i<len-1; i++){\n            sum += nums.get(i);\n            \n            \n            \n            if(sum>=m ){\n                \n                System.out.println(nums.subList(i+1, len));\n                \n                 head = canSplitArray(nums.subList(i+1, len), m);\n            }\n        }\n        \n        sum=0;\n        for(int i=len-1; i>0; i--){\n            sum += nums.get(i);\n            if(sum>=m )\n                tail = canSplitArray(nums.subList(0, i), m);\n            \n        }\n        \n        return head || tail;\n        \n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"check-if-it-is-possible-to-split-array","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
